laboratory_examinations.findings: Altered for all tested modalities; patients were unable to perceive noxious thermal stimuli and innocuous warm stimuli. Very high intensity stimuli were necessary for the perception of cold, touch, and mechanical pain sensory modalities.
Showed abnormalities of 30/15 ratio and blood pressure response to standing consistent with both sympathetic and parasympathetic system impairment.
Severe reduction of sweat production in both upper and lower limbs.
Revealed lack of myelinated and unmyelinated somatic and autonomic nerve fibers, with absence of Meissner corpuscles and epidermal nerve fibers.
Showed severe generalized axonal sensory neuropathy.
